radiographic_examinations.findings: The common bile duct is dilated in the region of the porta hepatis measuring approximately 7 mm. A stent is identified in the common bile duct. Superior to the pancreatic neck, there is a 3.4 x 3.3 x 2.5 cm hypoechoic mass corresponding to a necrotic lymph node seen on recent CT scan. The echogenicity of the liver is homogeneous and smooth without focal liver mass.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: LFTs improved from prior. CBD dilation at the porta hepatis similar to prior.

radiographic_examinations.findings: 3.6 cm ill-defined arterially hypo-enhancing lesion at the pancreaticoduodenal groove concerning for cancer. Note made of lymph node involvement including a 5-cm necrotic common hepatic lymph node. The lesion has mass effect on the IVC and the nodal conglomerate in case of the main portal vein and abuts the common hepatic artery.
